review_title: Abusive company to employees and individuals they care for
job_title: Home Alliance Coordinator in Anchorage, AK
pros: I loved the individuals I cared for.
cons: 1. Upon leaving Hope… the allowed employee's to have a “free for all” in our personal locked quarters. We had to file a police report on the company for theft of items and cash. 2. They allow employees with a history not treating a disabled person well, to continue to work in the homes. 3. Individuals in their care… lose access to their personal money that is kept by hope community resources. Parents and guardians can deposit funds directly… and the request is still denied.

review_title: Best Company I've Ever Worked For
job_title: Human Resources Assistant in Anchorage, AK
pros: I was employed at Hope for a total of four years - all years spent in the office. I left in 2014 because I moved out of state, and I can tell you that I constantly seek a culture that mirrors that of Hope. There is plenty of room for advancement and growth within the company, which I successfully managed to do during my time there. Everyone who works at Hope is there for a meaningful purpose well beyond the price tag that comes with a job, therefore attracting only the best and most heartfelt people to the company. Great emphasis on work-life balance, plus training and skills advancement is very accessible and often encouraged.
cons: Like all non-profits, don't expect a high salary working at Hope. However, I can truly say that the passion and enjoyment working with clients supported at Hope override the need for a high pay.

job_title: Behavioral Health Associate in Anchorage, AK
pros: Loved my coworkers and the people who we supported
cons: Was manipulated by my supervisor using the fact that I cared about the people we supported to work overtime. The reason we had so many extra hours was because so many people got fed up with the company and quit. High turnover rate means you're constantly moving around.

review_title: Live in supervisor of a group home for individuals who experience developmental disabilities
